objectives: Students will discuss food and dining out using Informal/Conversational register language
Students will engage with Horror themed scenarios related to food and dining out
Students will demonstrate appropriate use of informal level vocabulary and expressions
Students will create dialogues combining food and dining out content with Horror narrative elements

warm_up.description: Students explore food and dining out through a Horror lens using Informal/Conversational language
warm_up.scenario: Imagine a frightening or supernatural situation involving food and dining out

main_activities.description: Students learn and practice informal register vocabulary related to food and dining out in a horror context
Students engage in horror themed role-play about food and dining out using informal register
Students create original horror themed content about food and dining out in informal register

discussion_questions: How would you describe food and dining out in a Horror scenario?
What terror or darkness might be involved in food and dining out?
Can you create a Horror story about food and dining out?
How does food and dining out change when viewed through a Horror perspective?
What informal register expressions would you use to discuss this horror scenario?

role_play_scenarios.scenario: Horror situation involving food and dining out
roles: Character A: Using informal register in horror context
Character B: Responding in informal register within horror theme

topic_genre_blend: food and dining out with terror
food and dining out with darkness
food and dining out with mysterious

teacher_transformation_guide.register_guidance: Use Informal/Conversational throughout: Friendly, relaxed everyday speech
teacher_transformation_guide.genre_guidance: Frame all content with Horror theme: Fear, suspense, supernatural elements

assessment.register_focus: Students demonstrate mastery of Informal/Conversational register
assessment.genre_focus: Students engage with Horror themed content
criteria: Appropriate use of informal register language
Comprehension of topic within new context

methodology: Augmented CLT with Register & Genre Transformation
